info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:12PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Churchill, Storey, southern Washoe and north central Lyon Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 509 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Virginia Peak to Hallelujah Junction. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Deadly lightning, wind gusts up to 55 mph, blowing dust with reduced visibilities below 2 miles, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reno, Sparks, Fernley, Lockwood, Wingfield Springs, Northwest Reno, Spanish Springs, Cold Springs, Cold Springs Valley, Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley, Mogul, Golden Valley, Virginia Peak, Verdi-Mogul, Caughlin Ranch, Galena, Hidden Valley, Somersett, Nixon and Stead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Reno.
